intro.description: This cheat sheet shows you how to create a model from a JDBC source.

description.b: Follow steps below to create Teiid Model Project

subitem.label: Launch New Teiid Model Project Wizard

subitem.description:
1) Specify unique project name
2) Click Next > twice to get to Model Project Options page
3) Check folders you wish the wizard to create in your project
4) Click Finish

description.b: Follow steps below to create a JDBC Connection profile.

subitem.label: Launch New JDBC Source Connection Wizard

subitem.description:
1) Select Connection Profile Type (Driver type)
2) Enter unique profile name (example: Products Oracle 11)
3) Select applicable Driver (or create/edit)
4) Enter required driver into (Host, Port number, username, etc...)
5) Test connection to verify properties and driver selection
6) Click Finish

item.title: Create Source Model From JDBC Connection

description.b: Follow steps below to create a relational model by importing table data via your JDBC connection profile.

subitem.label: Launch Import from JDBC Source Wizard

subitem.description:
1) Select your JDBC source connection profile
2) Verify password and click Next >
3) Select designer import Table Types , check desired options and click Next >
4) Select desired database objects you wish to model (tables, columns, procedures, etc. and click Next >
5) Specify unique model name, folder and naming options and click Finish

description.b: This following action allows you to preview data from your newly generated JDBC view table.

subitem.description:
1) Click the browse "..." button to select the newly created view table
2) Click OK to execute the query
3) Results of the query will displayed in the SQL Results view

description.b: Follow steps below to create a new VDB

subitem.description:
1) Select "..." button to browse and select project or folder location.
2) Enter a unique name for your VDB
3) Enter an optional description for your VDB
4) Select the Add button to choose models to go in your VDB
5) Click Finish

description.b: Follow steps below to create a new VDB

subitem.description:
1) Select "..." button to browse and select a VDB.
2) Click OK to deploy VDB and open connection in Data Source Explorer
3) Follow instructions in open SQL Scrapbook Editor
4) View your query results in the SQL Results view
